Advantage: Data Analyst/Data Visualization Specialist
Are you a Data Analyst/Data Visualization Specialist with a sharp eye for detail? Are you ready to apply your expertise in a high-growth company that's shaping the future of healthcare? Look no further than Advantage. We're currently seeking a Full-Time Data Analyst/Data Visualization Specialist for our Corporate Office in the South Hills area of Pittsburgh (very close to Baldwin High School and South Hills Country Club). This will be an In-Office position.
About the Role
As a Data Analyst/Data Visualization Specialist, you will play a vital role in collecting, analyzing, and presenting data from various applications and database systems in the form of comprehensive data visualization dashboards. Your expertise in data analysis and reporting will contribute to informed leadership decision-making and drive organizational success.
What You’ll Do
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their reporting requirements and translate them into actionable report specifications.
Design, develop, and maintain database reports using reporting tools (e.g., Domo, SQL, Microsoft Power BI, Tableau) to meet business needs.
Extract and manipulate data from various vendors and databases, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Create visually appealing and easy-to-understand reports, dashboards, and visualizations that effectively communicate key metrics and findings.
Regularly update and distribute reports to relevant stakeholders, ensuring timely and accurate delivery.
Monitor and validate report data to ensure consistency and reliability.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation to streamline report generation and delivery.
Stay up to date with industry best practices and emerging trends in database reporting and visualization techniques.
Provide training and support to end users on report generation and interpretation.
About You
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Relevant certifications are a plus.
3+ years experience as a Database Analyst/Data Visualization Specialist or similar role.
Strong knowledge of database management and warehouse systems.
Demonstrated proficiency in data visualization and report writing tools and technologies:
Microsoft Power BI (Required)
Tableau, Domo or similar data visualization platforms (Required)
Solid understanding of data analysis techniques, data visualization principles, and report design best practices. - Demonstrated proficiency in data manipulation and transformation using tools like:
Excel
Scripting languages (e.g., Python, R)
SQL
Experience with systems integration and implementation of vendor applications.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with complex data sets.
Strong attention to detail and the ability to ensure data accuracy and quality in reports.
Effective communication skills to interact with stakeholders and present findings in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment.
Adaptability to changing priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced work environment.
Why Advantage?
Service, Quality, Results: At Advantage, these aren't just words. They're the principles guiding everything we do.
Expansive Growth: We're a high-growth provider and a market leader in Pennsylvania, with plans for rapid expansion into new geographies.
Patient-First Culture: Our corporate culture and commitment to superior clinical outcomes are the foundation of our success.
Join a Team of Experts: You'll be part of a team of professionals who are all committed to our motto, “You Deserve to Get Better: Better Service, Better Quality, and Better Results.”
Join the Advantage Team as a Data Analyst/Data Visualization Specialist and contribute to data-driven decision-making and organizational success. Apply today and be part of our mission to leverage the power of data for actionable insights!
Note: This job description is for reference purposes only and may be subject to change based on the specific needs of the organization.

Acts as an in-house workstation and software consultant.

Under general supervision, may participate on Corporate approved projects.

Health. Life. Retirement. The Physicians Mutual family empowers people from all walks of life to enjoy the financial security they deserve. That’s what Insurance for all of us® is about.

Firm Overview
Keystone is a premier strategy and economics consulting firm solving the most complex challenges of competition, strategy, and intellectual property for leading technology firms and global brands. We work at the forefront of influential technology cases changing consumer behavior and regulation laws and impacting society on a global scale. Keystone brings an interdisciplinary approach, leveraging the intersection of economics, technology, and business strategy to deliver transformative ideas.
Responsibilities
As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our data infrastructure and systems. Your expertise in data engineering will play a pivotal role in enabling data-driven solutions and empowering our team of analysts and consultants. Your responsibilities will include:
Assist client-facing teams with big data requests and challenges by building reproducible data pipelines and analytic processes to derive value for the teams.
Work closely with cross-functional teams of data scientists, engagement managers, and consultants to identify areas of opportunity and value.
Support projects with automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, designing infrastructure for scale, etc.
Leverage the appropriate infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and ‘big data’ technologies.
Help create, maintain, and implement tools, libraries, and systems to increase the efficiency and scalability of the team.
Build tools and APIs to deploy data science and machine learning models at scale on projects.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science or highly related technical field and 2-3 years experience working on data analysis, data science, ETL
Advanced proficiency working with data analysis languages (Python, R, SQL)
Experience with orchestration and big data tools including Airflow, Snowflake, dbt, Spark, etc.
Knowledge of the Software Development Lifecycle principles and interest in applying to a fast-paced, data-focused role.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and version control (git) preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree in computer science or highly related technical field
Experience with GCP or AWS cloud services
A desire to be a part of and help grow a great team and organization
The passion to learn, grow, and help us to improve our business
Ability to quickly adapt to new technologies
Capacity to work within complex systems and large data sets
US Salary Range: $100,000 - $175,000, plus an annual discretionary bonus, 401k contribution, and competitive benefits package. Actual compensation within the range will depend upon the level the individual is hired into based on their skills, experience, qualifications.
At Keystone we believe diversity matters. At every level of our firm, we seek to advance and promote diversity, foster an inclusive culture, and ensure our colleagues have a deep sense of respect and belonging. If you are interested in growing your career with colleagues from varied backgrounds and cultures, consider Keystone Strategy.

Company Overview: West Valley Construction Co. Inc., is a leading underground utility construction company committed to delivering high-quality infrastructure design solutions, specializing in the installation and maintenance of essential utilities such as water, sewer, power, gas, and telecommunications. We provide 24/7 emergency response for most of our major customers. Proudly employee-owned, we are rooted in the belief that every team member contributes to our continued success and growth. We demonstrate this commitment through our Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), allowing employees to directly share in the success of the company. Headquartered in Campbell, CA, West Valley additionally has operating facilities located in Bakersfield, Campbell, Chico, Concord, Fresno, Hayward, Redwood City, Sacramento, Salinas, Stockton, and Visalia. As we continue to grow and expand operations, we seek talented individuals to be part of our team and share in our continued prosperity through our ESOP program.

We are looking for a Programmer to join our Information Technology team in Campbell, CA!

Job Summary: The Programmer will assist in enhancing our data-driven decision-making capabilities, working closely under the guidance of our Senior Integration Programmer. This role is central to managing data using SQL, leveraging third-party APIs, and assisting in the implementation of enterprise applications from external vendors. By building dashboards and automating processes, the Programmer will ensure data is not only accessible but also translates into actionable insights and efficiency improvements across departments. The ideal candidate is expected to support the development and deployment of scalable, enterprise-level solutions, providing robust, user-friendly reporting to aid the organization's growth.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Below is a compilation of primary job duties and responsibilities for this role, supplemented by certain supportive tasks. This list is not exhaustive, and additional duties and responsibilities may be assigned as required. Moreover, management reserves the right to make modifications to this job description as deemed necessary.

Assist with the collection, extraction, and management of data through SQL and third-party APIs for reporting and business intelligence purposes.
Support the implementation and integration of non-internally developed enterprise applications, ensuring they align with internal systems and data workflows.
Aid in creating and maintaining dynamic reports and dashboards using tools like PowerBI.
Contribute to the creation of automated processes and workflows with Microsoft Power Automate, improving the efficiency and integration of business systems.
Collaborate with departmental teams to understand their reporting needs and assist in providing technical solutions.
Help maintain up-to-date documentation for all data processes and automated systems developed.
Support the optimization and performance tuning of database queries and API integrations under senior staff's supervision.
Engage in troubleshooting and resolving any technical issues related to data integration and reporting.

Qualifications:
Education/Experience: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field, or equivalent work experience in a similar role. A minimum of 2 years' experience in programming, with a focus on data analysis, integration, and reporting. Demonstrable skills in SQL programming and database management. While not a strict requirement candidates with formal experience in Systems Administration are highly desired, bringing valuable insights into user and system requirements that enrich data integration and management practices. Proficiency in following established best practices for software / database development and security to ensure robust and compliant IT solutions.
Computer Skills: Knowledge of API use for data extraction and familiarity with integrating and implementing enterprise software solutions. Experience with Microsoft Power Automate and PowerBI for the development of business automation and insightful reporting. While not a strict requirement, candidates with experience in using industry-specific software such as Viewpoint, Bid2Win, and Flowfinity are highly desired.
Interpersonal Skills: good communication skills, capable of interacting effectively with a wide range of technical and non-technical stakeholders. A proactive learner, keen to advance skills under the mentorship of senior programmers and through engaging with new technologies and practices.
Organization and Planning: Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities.

Physical Requirements:
Ability to read, write, speak and comprehend English.
Hearing adequate to perform job duties in person.
Ability to communicate effectively with others.
Visual acuity adequate to perform job duties as indicated.
Frequent bending, reaching, walking, squatting, sitting, and standing regularly throughout the work shift.
Manual dexterity to operate computer keyboard.

Salary:
$120,000/year - $140,000/year

Benefits:
Opportunity to be an owner in the company through the Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), and Stock Purchase Plan (SPP) with discounted price.
Annual performance bonus opportunities.
Vacation, and paid sick leave.
5 group health insurance plans: 2 with HSAs; company pays 95% of employee premium and 85% of dependent premium for Blue Shield Plans, and 95% of the premium for employee and dependents for Kaiser Plans.

West Valley Construction Company is an equal opportunity workplace, and does not discriminate against any protected class. What You Need for this Position

Experience developing software with Java and C++ in object oriented
Working experience with Microsoft and LINUX operating environments
Preferred, but not required:
Current DoD Secret Security Clearance
Experience developing HTML5 Web Applications
Experience developing software under Agile principles
Experience with User Interfaces (UI) and Human/Machine Interface (HMI) concepts
Experience with Eclipse and Visual Studio is desired
Other preferred Experience with the following tools and application concepts is a plus: Maven, Junit, Easy Mock, JIRA, GET, Fisheye, Bitbucket, World Wind, SIMDIS, ESRI, GJIS, BOSS, NSITE, Wireshark, LUA, Bash, Perl, and VMWare.
What’s In It for You?
Competitive Salary, Strong Compensation and Benefits package! If you are a Software Engineer that meets the minimum aforementioned requirements, please apply today!

Work directly with users to translate requirements into system specifications. Maintain current knowledge of standard languages, coding methods and operations requirements. Analyze existing program logic to determine best method of accomplishing required changes or cause of program malfunction. Perform maintenance and modification of programs currently in production to keep them responsive to user needs and to assure efficient operation in the production environment. Analyze production programs to isolate problems or to determine more efficient methods. Maintain a customer service-oriented work approach towards internal and external customers. Review, test results to ensure compliance with all requirements and design specifications create and maintain application documentation as required for specified work assignment. SQL, PLSQL, Design and development of applications using J2EE Technologies, JDBC, Java Servlets, JMS, EJB, Visual Basic, C, C++, .NET, ETL INFORMATICA, AGILE Methodology (SCRUM) SQL* PLUS, Crystal reports, business objects. This job is available to work from home or remote location.

Master’s degree in Computer Science (any), Engineering (any), MBA (any) or alternatively a Bachelor’s degree (any) with 5 years of relevant experience acceptable.
Location: Edison, NJ
Position type: Full Time;
Mail resume to: I5 Tech Inc., Attn: HR Manager, 3 Ethel Road, Suite 306, Edison, NJ 08817 or E-Mail: careers@i5techinc.com
SOFTWARE ENGINEERS / DEVELOPERS:
Analyze, design, develop, test, Implement, troubleshoot and maintain software applications using following skills:
Java Developer: - (Job Code # -001)
OOPs Concepts & Patterns, Abstract Classes and Interfaces, Constructors, File IO and Serialization, Collections – List, Map, Set, Access Specifiers, Exceptions – Checked, Unchecked, Generics, Java Keywords – Static, Final, volatile, synchronized, transient, this super etc., JVM and Memory Management, Multithreading and Synchronization, Dependency Injection, JSP / Servlets, Web Frameworks like Struts / Spring, Service Oriented Architecture / Web Services – SOAP / REST, Web Technologies like HTML, CSS, Java script and JQuery, Markup Languages like XML and JSON
Dot Net Developer: - (Job Code # -002)
ASP.NET, ASP.NET MVC, .NET MVC (Model View Controller), EF, Entity Framework, ADO.NET Entity Framework, Windows Communication Foundation, WCF, SOA, Service-Oriented Architecture, ASP.NET MVC 3/4/5 are similar, ASP.NET Core MVC is a bit different than ASP.NET MVC 5, ASP.NET MVC 1 and ASP.NET MVC 2 are similar, ASP.NET MVC 3 is different than ASP.NET MVC 2, C# (there were a few of them: 7.0;7.1;7.2;73) is a bit different than C# 6.0 Entity Framework was renamed Entity Framework Core because it was completely rewritten from scratch
Data Base Developer: - (Job Code # -003)
Knowledge of database queries, database theory, database design, about the RDBMS itself, e.g. Microsoft SQL Server or MySQL, structured query language (SQL), e.g. SQL/PSM or Transact-SQL, General understanding of distributed computing architectures, e.g. Client–server model, operating system, e.g. Windows or Linux, storage technologies and networking, understanding of routine maintenance, recovery, and handling failover of a database
NETWORK ENGINEERS: - (Job Code # -004)
Analytical and problem-solving skills; aptitude for creativity and design, customer-service skills; the ability to lead a team; knowledge of mathematics, telecommunications, and electronics; ability to use analytical, network security, network monitoring, and administration software programs; familiarity with network analyzers, network switches, and wireless LAN servers
DATABASE ADMINISTRATORS: - (Job Code # -005)
Good understanding of the Oracle database, related utilities and tools, underlying operating system, physical database design. Ability to perform both Oracle and operating system performance tuning and monitoring, Knowledge of ALL Oracle backup and recovery scenarios, Oracle security management, how Oracle acquires and manages resources, Oracle data integrity, implemented application systems knowledge in code migration, database change management and data management through the various stages of the development life cycle, database and system performance tuning, Provide a strategic database direction for the organization
COMPUTER SYSTEM ANALYST/ BUSINESS ANALYST: - (Job Code # -006)
Liaising extensively with external or internal clients; analyzing clients' existing systems and business models; mapping and documenting interfaces between legacy and new systems; understanding software development lifecycle; translating client requirements into highly specified project briefs; identifying options for potential solutions and assessing them for both technical and business suitability; conducting requirements analysis and preparing specific proposals for modified or replacement systems; developing solutions and related products; producing project feasibility and costings reports; presenting proposals to clients; working closely with colleagues, developers, testers and a variety of end users to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction; ensuring that budgets are adhered to and deadlines are met; drawing up, supervising and documenting testing schedules for complete systems; overseeing implementation of a new system including data migration; planning and working flexibly to deadlines; supporting users on change control and system updates; providing training and user manuals to users of a new system; keeping up to date with technical and industry developments.
Required: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field of study; Experience in the required skills set is a must.
Location: Edison, NJ

TPA Stream is looking for an experienced Python Software Developer to help us engineer the next generation of Python/React-based apps. In this role contribute to the quality of our core product and new product applications. You’ll collaborate with our other developers, designers, and support team while maintaining concise and optimal code.
Description
THE COMPANY
TPA Stream is a software company in the health insurance and employee benefits space. With two technical co-founders actively involved in the development of our product, we are continuously committed to working with cutting edge technology and excellent development practices. Some of the tools we most commonly work with are Python, Kubernetes , React , Google Cloud Platform, AWS, PostgreSQL, Linux, Flask, SQLAlchemy, Celery, and Marshmallow. We rely on extensive unit testing and practice continuous delivery.

We’re a high-growth startup and are always looking for bright, talented people to join our team.

WORK ENVIRONMENT
The TPA Stream team primarily works remotely. We dress casually, we like to laugh, and we like to eat lunch together when possible.

You will be expected to contribute to all aspects of the software development lifecycle including pitching your ideas, working with requirements, and partnering with cross-organization teams to bring ideas to reality
Design, architecture, implementation, and testing of software applications
Support and troubleshoot existing software in production
Present new code design and implementation patterns, as well as potential enhancements to the existing codebase to peers for review as part of our overall code quality process
Mentor junior developers to help increase level of understanding and ability in related technologies and methodologies

GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS
a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience,
3+ years of software development experience,
experience using version control in a larger (more than 2 developers) team environment,
basic understanding of bash / command line tools,
strong understanding of HTTP and web technology,
experience using python, ruby, php, java, or other similar languages
strong understanding of the latest trends in JavaScript

TECHNICAL QUALIFICATIONS
PROFICIENT WITH THE FOLLOWING TECHNOLOGIES:
Python/SQL programming
React
Kubernetes
Google Cloud Platform
AWS
PostgreSQL
Linux, Flask
SQLAlchemy
Celery and Marshmallow
We rely on extensive unit testing and practice continuous delivery.

NICE-TO-HAVES
Knowledge of
TPAs (Third Party Administrators)
CDH (Consumer Directed Healthcare)
Includes FSAs (Flexible Spending Accounts),
HSAs (Health Savings Accounts),
HRAs (Health Reimbursement Arrangements)
Sense of humor :)

PERKS
A competitive base salary plus bonus, stock options and employer-paid life insurance
Unlimited PTO
Flexible Work Schedule / Work Remote Available
Great Benefits that are available immediately upon hire
Opportunity for advancement, based on performance
You get to work closely with our Founders

This job is:
For all ages including older job seekers
Open to applicants who do not have a college diploma

This job is ideal for someone who is:
Dependable- more reliable than spontaneous
Detail-oriented- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture
Achievement-oriented- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail
Autonomous/Independent- enjoys working with little direction

Job type Full Time
Visa sponsorship Not Available
Remote work policy Mainly Remote – WFH flexibility

Job Summary
PLEASE NOTE: This position is not budgeted for employer-sponsored immigration support, this includes all persons in F (both CPT and OPT), J, H, L, or O status.


The overall purpose of this position is to develop and sustain an Advanced Analytics practice using Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) within Global Meetings, Conferences, and Events (MCE) - Business Intelligence. This is a hands-on position and the incumbent in this position is primarily responsible for the development, design, implementation, and rollout of advanced analytics solutions using AI & ML models, with the goal of gaining an in-depth understanding of IEEE's conferences and conference attendees data and thereby improving insight into IEEE's conference business. The role will report to the Manager, Business Reporting and Analytics, and will not manage any direct reports. The individual in this position is expected to work independently under minimum direction and supervision.

Key Responsibilities
Developing Advanced Analytics solutions and Data Visualization
Designs and builds leading edge predictive models and AI/ML algorithms for initial simulations or prototypes and subsequent ingestion into mainstream software applications
Designs and develops data collection processes to support these models
Builds a structure and process for modeling, predicting, and classifying user behavior and other business metrics
Studies, explores and evaluates new and existing data sources to determine their effectiveness and accuracy for use in AI/ML models. Provide actionable recommendations to business stakeholders
Project lead for conferences in organization-wide data analytics initiatives.
Evaluate software tools & techniques and make recommendations to business processes.
Collaborate with IT on implementation and security for new tools
They will also assist with identifying areas of business process improvement and recommend process adjustments, technical solutions, or both to efficiently carry out operational objectives.
Engages in cross-functional collaboration to define the requirements for business process solutions.
Finally, the incumbent will support the creation and iteration of long-term goals, objectives, and strategies for IEEE’s Conference Business

Qualifications

Education
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience degree in Finance/ Computer Science/ Statistics/ related fields or equivalent experience; Advance degree a plus Req
Work Experience
2-4 years of hands-on experience in AI and ML model development. Pref
2-4 years of hands-on experience and expertise in R, and Python. Pref
4-7 years in developing Advanced Analytics solutions, including but not limited to, Data Visualization tools(tableau, Power BI, or other). Pref
2-4 years of expert knowledge of Microsoft Power Platform Pref
2-4 years experience with workflow automation (at a citizen developer level) Pref
4-7 years of hands-on experience in building Data integration, Data mining, and ETL solutions. Pref
4-7 years experience in SQL and other traditional Data Analysis tools. Pref

Proven ability to initiate and drive projects from conception to completion.

Summary
The Research Software Engineer I is responsible for building and maintaining software applications or systems derived from research and projects managed by the Health Services and Informatics Research team. Requires a significant set of technical skills, including a deep knowledge of multiple programming languages, software architecture, and relationship databases. Shares knowledge and/or provides support for team members. Develops positive working relationships with co-workers. Contributes to and promotes a positive and professional work environment/atmosphere.

Develops, maintains, and documents mobile, web, and/or desktop applications used for research and operations support. Develops, maintains, and documents backend infrastructure supporting mobile, web, and/or desktop applications developed in-house. Designs, maintains, and documents database schemas used by backend infrastructure. Architects and builds scalable, testable, and reusable code using best practices in software engineering. Listens to project stakeholders and translates stakeholder needs into software requirements. Works closely with User Experience Research Specialists to produce usable and desirable applications. Creates technical documentation for long-term maintenance of developed software, and reports for nontechnical people. Documents work process to ensure redundancy. Supports other Informatics Research team with data science needs, such as building systems processing data for research purposes.

Works with research team members to execute projects effectively and efficiently.

Education
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, or related field; Master’s degree preferred.

Experience
Minimum of 3 years’ experience with software development (experience acquired during internships and school projects may be considered). 3+ years of experience with full stack development for web or mobile. 3+ years of experience with database schema design and dimensional data modeling. Experience using version control software. Experience with Windows, Electron, or Flutter development appreciated but not required.

Other Qualifications
Demonstrated mastery of at least one client-facing programming language (e.g., Java, Dart, TypeScript) and one server-facing programming language (e.g., JavaScript with NodeJS, Python, PHP, Perl). Good knowledge of object-oriented principles and software patterns. Knowledge of PHP, JavaScript, and MS SQL Server preferred. Knowledge of MATLAB, Python, or other language for data science appreciated but not required. Must be able to work on multiple projects concurrently. Must have good verbal and written communication skills. Must be organized and able to work autonomously.

The Jr. Data Scientist role is a unique employment opportunity for students seeking to gain on-the-job data science & analytics experience and receive excellent mentoring while completing their education. Jr. Data Scientists are immersed in an Amazon team and work on exciting, meaningful projects that impact real Amazon customers. Paired 1:1 with a Amazon Jr. Data Science Mentor, Jr. Data Scientists receive guidance and support in all aspects of their role: skill development, career advisement, project collaboration, and more! Upon successful completion of the Jr. Data Scientist Program, the opportunity for full-time employment will be available at the Amazon corporate sites in San Diego, CA.

The Jr. Data Scientist role is part of the Jr Developer Program, a unique internship program in several respects:
We offer employment year-round, part-time (16 hrs/week) while in school and full-time (40hrs/week) during summer. Working schedules are flexible and can be re-arranged each quarter to accommodate class schedules.
We offer excellent mentoring. Our full-time data scientists, applied scientists and business intelligence engineers are willing and able to mentor exceptional student data scientists, applied scientists and BIEs.
Jr. Data Scientists are given responsibilities and roles that prepare them to enter the workforce after graduation with “real world” data science and analytics experience.
Jrs. who participate in the Jr. Developer Program routinely acknowledge the valuable learning experience created by the uniform excellence of their teams, mentoring offered by experienced Amazonians, and the challenge of being a principal contributor to science and software products.

Key job responsibilities
Create pipelines for reports, analyze massive-scale data, leverage knowledge in machine learning, advanced analytics, metrics, reporting, and analytic tooling/languages like SQL, Excel, and others, to analyze and translate the data into meaningful insights; make sense of the results and be able to explain what it all means to key stakeholders like scientists, product managers, and engineers.
Analyze large amounts of data, discover and solve real world problems and build metrics and business cases around key performance of this program.
Use a customer backwards approach in deriving insights and identifying actions we can take to improve the customer experience and conversion for the program.
We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

San Diego, CA, USA

Previous technical internship(s).
Effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions.
Adept at handling ambiguous or undefined problems as well as ability to think abstractly.

Job Description
The Systems Technician is responsible for the technical, administrative, and training duties in connection with "End User Support" through the Authority's Information Technology department. The position is responsible for installing, maintaining, and troubleshooting PC hardware and software. The Systems Technician is responsible for all phases of hardware and software support to end users along with providing assistance to the Enterprise and Networking groups as needed. This position reports to the Desktop Support Manager and requires reliability, dependability, and accountability in all aspects of the defined role.

Job Responsibilities
95%
The list of essential functions, as outlined herein, is intended to be representative of the tasks performed within this classification. It is not necessarily descriptive of any one position in the class. The omission of an essential function does not preclude management from assigning duties not listed herein if such functions are a logical assignment to the position.

Provide a high level of technical support to end users to troubleshoot and resolve hardware and software problems.

Perform hardware and software evaluations and diagnostics and resolve and/or make recommendations to existing systems.

Install and configure hardware and software according to specifications.

Set up (and upgrade) workstations and necessary peripheral devices as needed.

Configuration of new systems to best serve the different disciplines of the Authority.

Assist Network Administrator in researching and implementing Operating System updates and patches.

Assist Desktop Support Manager in all aspects of "user support".

Assist in the development of the Authority's Computer Training Programs; evaluate and if needed, develop instructional materials. Provide orientation and guidance to users on new software and/or computer equipment.

Maintain an on-going knowledge of constantly changing hardware and software drivers and utilities while implementing these updates accordingly.

Travel periodically off-site within Palm Beach County to perform preventive maintenance on workstations and peripheral equipment at remote facilities.

Assist the Telecom Administrator for Avaya system administration support.




KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITY
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Thorough knowledge of Windows Domain operations as well as computer hardware and software with regard to their operations.

Ability to communicate effectively with programmers, technicians, operators, end users, co-workers and supervisors.

Ability to comprehend and provide support to end user’s needs.

Knowledge of Cloud Computing, including services offered by Adobe, Microsoft, Sophos, etc.

Thorough knowledge of Microsoft Windows Operating Systems and technology, related hardware drivers, Microsoft Office 365 and Multi Factor Authentication required.

Knowledge of Avaya Telecom system.

Knowledge of basic networking and associated technologies.

Through knowledge of the Windows Registry, User and Software Profiles, Network Protocols, VPN and other remote access technologies.

Ability to understand and follow complex oral and written instructions and to present oral and written reports clearly and concisely.

Ability to speak, understand, and write the English language sufficiently to converse effectively with the general public, peers, and subordinates; to respond to inquiries, and to make entries on reports and records.

Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

Ability to read and interpret documents (e.g., operating and maintenance instructions, procedure manuals, etc.).

Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization.

Requires regular and reliable attendance.

Physical Requirements
The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that an employee will encounter and must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

This position is regularly performed in a typical office environment and is quiet and climate controlled. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is routinely required to sit; talk; hear; stand; walk; use hands to touch, handle, and feel; reach with hands and arms; and stoop. Kneel, couch, or crawl. The employee must exert or lift to twenty-five (25) pounds of force occasionally to move objects. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
The ideal candidate possesses the education and experience listed below.
Associates degree (A.S or A.A.) or equivalent from an accredited university, college, or technical school with major coursework in computer science or related field.
Minimum three to five years computer related experience.
Any combination of experience, education and training that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities to perform the essential functions of the position.

CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSES
Valid Florida Driver’s license required.

Job Title: Full-Stack Engineer Training Program - June 2024 Cohort
Job Description:
Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.
Program Start Date: June 17, 2024
Location: Hybrid
Starting Salary: $73,500
The pay range for this role is: $70,000 - $80,000
Please apply to be considered as a candidate if the starting salary is within your desired salary expectation.
Are you looking for a two-year program to learn how to code and become a full-stack automation engineer?

Good news, CVS Health’s Enterprise Technology Services (ETS) organization in IT is welcoming individuals to join our Infrastructure Software Engineering Program (ISEP). This is a two-year developmental program to learn how to be an automation engineer, work within a fast-paced IT organization, and support our customers. In this two-year program, you will receive training, support, hands-on experience, and feedback from more experienced developers. There will be built in training, webinars, simulations, game days, and other fresh approaches to learning. We are truly investing in your future and your growth as a full-stack developer. This unique two-year program is built with the growth mindset, allowing you the time and experience to learn how to develop and support our shift towards a Software Driven Enterprise using modern delivery methods like Agile and Extreme Programming (XP). We are excited to welcome candidates to a unique opportunity to learn and support a Fortune 6 company.

Some of the responsibilities you’ll have in this position include:
Assisting in the support of existing applications and/or development efforts.
Writing high-quality code compliant with enterprise and industry regulations.
Collaborating with business analysts and product owners to ensure understanding of business priorities.
Analyzing and improving the efficiency of various systems and services.
Proactively monitoring industry trends and identifying opportunities to implement new technologies.
Creating and executing required test scenarios/plans to ensure complete testing on all new and changed components.
Sharing knowledge openly and willingly with other IT business personnel.
Troubleshooting problems identified by users.
Use automation tools like Ansible, Jenkins, etc. for automating uses cases.
Work within model delivery frameworks (Agile, XP, Kanban)

Please note this position is available fully remote, preferably local to any state on the East Coast due to business needs.

Required Qualifications
1+ years of experience (academic or professional) in a relevant IT position.
6+ months of experience programming, developing or coding.

Preferred Qualifications

Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Demonstrated history or continuous learning, growth, and improvement.
Ability to work well both independently and as part of a cohort.
Python experience.
PowerShell / YAML.
Experience in algorithms, data structures and general computer science concepts.
Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment.
Hands on experience with data integrations.
Experience with relational and no-sql databases.
Experience with Machine Learning concepts.
Experience with designs, coding, and testing new, enterprise-wide applications.
Front End Design using Angular, React, No JS

Education Verifiable High School Diploma or GED required. Boot camps, Academies, Certifications, etc. seriously considered.

Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, management information systems, or related degree preferred.

Work visa sponsorship is not available for this role. This includes participation in Curricular Practical Training (CPT), Optional Practical Training (OPT), and F-1 Visa programs.
Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors.

In addition to your compensation, enjoy the rewards of an organization that puts our heart into caring for our colleagues and our communities. The Company offers a full range of medical, dental, and vision benefits. Eligible employees may enroll in the Company’s 401(k) retirement savings plan, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan is also available for eligible employees. The Company provides a fully-paid term life insurance plan to eligible employees, and short-term and long term disability benefits. CVS Health also offers numerous well-being programs, education assistance, free development courses, a CVS store discount, and discount programs with participating partners. As for time off, Company employees enjoy Paid Time Off (“PTO”) or vacation pay, as well as paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Number of paid holidays, sick time and other time off are provided consistent with relevant state law and Company policies.

Why Crescent Community Health Center? Crescent is a mission driven, patient centered organization. Crescent provides medical, dental and brain health services to the Greater Dubuque area including our most vulnerable populations. Summary: The Data Analyst is an important member of the Quality Improvement & Data Analytics Team. The role will have responsibilities in maintaining data integrity and developing reports. This position will apply knowledge of the business and available data to aid in the development of data-driven solutions. Additionally, this role will maintain and improve existing reporting from our EPIC Health Record system.
Essential Duties:
Supports data needs/requests related to QI projects including, but not limited to, UDS, workflow processes and population health management.
Interprets and applies quality improvement standards to care metrics to ensure high quality care.
Integrates and analyzes data to evaluate effectiveness of quality improvement program making recommendations for changes as appropriate.
Compiles statistical data, written narrative reports, and dashboards to summarize findings.
Drives collaboration between departments by sharing data and process improvements.
Identifies, implements, and utilizes data tools and analytic software to measure and evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of core strategies and key initiatives affiliated with project management.
Presents QI data to employee groups as requested.
Creates, maintains, and refreshes reports.
Develops ad hoc and on-going reporting based on business requirements using various reporting systems.
Performs data audits to ensure accuracy of complex healthcare data.
Assist with data visualizations and prep for monthly meetings.
Maintains a friendly, respectful, professional, and culturally appropriate atmosphere for patients and staff.
Maintains the highest levels of confidentiality for patients and staff.
Stays current with changing best practices and technologies.
Upholds and promotes all company policies and procedures.

Qualifications:
Education/Experience: Will consider a combination of education, training, and/or experience.
Bachelor's degree or in pursuit of degree, in computer science, MIS, economics, finance, data analytics or a related field preferred.
Preferred work experience in health care analytics.
Experience with electronic health records such as EPIC and data analytics platforms such as Crystal reports, Epic reports, or Business Objects, preferred.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Word, Powerpoint and Excel formulas, graphs, crosstabs, and data formatting, required.
Pre-employment drug testing and background check required.

THE OFFICE OF COURT ADMINISTRATION - WEB DESIGN TEAM IS SEEKING APPLICATIONS FOR A POSITION IN THE WEB DEVELOPER SERIES. THE POSITION WILL BE FILLED IN ONE OF THE FOLLOWING TITLES DEPENDENT ON THE QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE OF THE APPLICANT SELECTED.
POSITION TITLE: Web Developer JG: 26
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science or related field and three (3) years of demonstrated progressive experience in web content development and programming; or An equivalent combination of education and experience.
DISTINGUISHING FEATURES OF WORK: Under general supervision of the Website Systems Director, Web Developers are responsible for performing all tasks related to the Unified Court System's (UCS) web sites. Web Developers work with other members of the web team to create, reformat, adapt, update, monitor and test content for the UCS web sites. Web Developers assist in managing all Web application development projects, assemble cross-functional resources to support Web initiatives, and evaluate new web technologies. Web Developers also perform other related duties.
POSITION TITLE: Assistant Web Developer JG: 24
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science or related field and six months of demonstrated progressive experience in web content development and programming; or An equivalent combination of education and experience.
DISTINGUISHING FEATURES OF WORK: Under general supervision of the Website Systems Director, Assistant Web Developers are responsible for performing tasks related to the Unified Court System's (UCS) web sites. Assistant Web Developers work with other members of the web team to reformat, adapt, update, monitor and test content for the UCS web sites. Assistant Web Developers also perform other related duties.
ASSIGNMENT: Duties include, but are not limited to: maintaining the Drupal content management system; organizing content and structuring navigation of the website; reviewing and revising all content to ensure technical and grammatical standards are met; conducting usability testing and analyzing data; implementing content updates; providing oral and written responses to website email inquiries; evaluating new web technologies; assisting with writing original content for the Court’s website and preparing written and oral reports. Demonstrated experience with Drupal, HTML, CSS, GIT for version control, and FTP is required. Knowledge of Composer, Drush, MySQL, and SASS is a plus. Some work outside of regular hours is required. Candidates with experience maintaining a Drupal content management system are encouraged to apply.

A3 Technology, Inc. is seeking a junior level Computer Scientist to join our Aeronautical Information Management Modernization team in Egg Harbor Township, NJ. The Aeronautical Information Management Modernization (AIMM) provides Aeronautical Common Services (ACS) as the single trusted access point of Aeronautical Information including Special Activity Airspace, Federal NOTAM System and airport configuration data integration and ingestion of eNational Airspace System Resource (eNASR) and Special Use Airspace (SUA) Management System (SAMS) data through eNASR and SAMS SWIM services.

Essential Job Functions:
Provide 2nd level engineering support for the Aeronautical Common Service (ACS).
Support system development, testing, integration and deployment activities for ACS.
Support the installs, configuring, monitoring and maintaining of Linux systems.
Develop test procedures.
Develop and manage Linux shell scripts to support application software testing and administration.
Able to debug software issues in Linux environments.
Possess a technical understanding of systems, databases, networking, computing environments and virtualization.
Able to read, decipher, troubleshoot XML files and WSDLs.
Create and conduct Web Service tests using SoapUI.
Review and comment on system engineering documents, system requirement documents and system testing documents.
Attend system design reviews, technical interchange meetings and any other meetings as requested to support the program and team.
Able to support software applications in RHEL environments.
Able to debug software issues in RHEL environments.
Work independently with close supervision.
Provide support in software requirements analysis, design, design reviews, development, software testing, integration, installation and maintenance of complex computer systems.
Will work with software programming languages such as Java, XML and SQL.
Familiarity with object-oriented programming techniques, client/server development, cross-browser development and Unix/Linux skills may be required.
May need to work with specialists from other disciplines such as hardware, software, logistic support and testing to produce fully integrated and responsive components and systems.
Interpret and analyze complex information systems data to develop technical documentation, system diagrams and presentation materials.
Work independently under general guidelines or objectives.
Must be willing to travel. On call 24x7 for site support.
Full-time position, standard work hours.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Required:
Working knowledge and background of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) Operating Systems.
Working knowledge of Linux shell scripting.
Working knowledge of VMware virtual environment.
Technical understanding of systems, databases, networking and computing environments.
Knowledge of automated test tools.
Working knowledge of XML.
US Citizenship or documented proof of eligibility to work in the US is required.
Upon conditional offer of employment candidates will be subject to a Government investigation and must meet eligibility requirements to obtain Government clearance.
Verification of past employment, verification of education and references are also required.

Preferred:
Working knowledge of Web Service Testing with SoapUI Test tool.
Unix/Linux Operating Systems Administration skills.
Working knowledge of networking, client server architecture, cloud computing and enterprise system architecture.
Knowledge of server operations, data communications and systems analysis and networks.
Solid understanding of IP network technologies and software tools for performance monitoring and troubleshooting.
Possess a technical understanding of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), Java Message Service (JMS), Web Services (NOT Web Page Development) and Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) Communication Protocol.
Knowledge of SQL scripts for relational database testing.
Knowledge of Python scripting.
Working knowledge of task automation methods and software (e.g. Ansible, scripting).

Education:
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Math, or other technical degree from a college or university accredited by an accrediting body recognized by the U.S. Department of Education with a minimum of thirty (30) semester hours in a combination of mathematics, statistics and computer science and (3) years of related work experience in a computer science or math field OR
Masters of Science in Computer Science, Math, or other technical degree from a college or university accredited by an accrediting body recognized by the U.S. Department of Education with a minimum of thirty (30) semester hours in a combination of mathematics, statistics and computer science and (1) year of related work experience in a computer science or math field.

At PrizePicks, we are the fastest growing sports company in North America, as recognized by Inc. 5000. As the leading platform for Daily Fantasy Sports, we cover a diverse range of sports leagues, including the NFL, NBA, and Esports titles like League of Legends and Counter-Strike. Our team of over 400 employees thrives in an inclusive culture that values individuals from diverse backgrounds, regardless of their level of sports fandom. Ready to reimagine the DFS industry together?
The Analytics Team is responsible for building and maintaining analytics tools and workflows to support the PrizePicks business across all departments — at the core of these operations is data. As a Data Science Engineer, you will be developing, maintaining, and testing streaming data and MLOps infrastructures to enable PrizePicks to offer real-time priced markets within the product.
What you'll do:
Create and maintain optimal sport data stream architecture, ensuring data reliability in both speed and quality for both raw and transformed data pipelines.
Partner with Data Science to determine the best paths for operationalization of DS/ML assets, ensuring model output quality, stability, and scalability.
Lead the design and implementation of the data and MLOps stack required for real-time pricing models and contribute to architecture evaluations and decisions for our growing data product roadmap.
Work cross-functionally with Engineering, QA, and Product teams to enable the creation and distribution of highly-visible, real-time, in-game micromarket offerings to the PrizePicks platform.
Build and own rigorous monitoring, alerting, and documentation processes, and work with Engineering teams to ensure complete feature uptime.
What you have:
3+ years of experience in a data science, machine learning engineer, or data-oriented software engineering role creating and pushing end-to-end data science pipelines and MLOps assets to production.
Experience building and optimizing cloud-based data streaming pipelines and infrastructure.
Experience exposing real-time predictive model outputs to production-grade systems leveraging large-scale distributed data processing and model training.
Experience with the following:
Strong organizational, communication, presentation, and collaboration experience with organizational technical and non-technical teams
Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Informatics, Information Systems or other quantitative field
Preferred: experience building real-time production data science pipelines in a daily fantasy sports or oddsmaking business
Where you'll live:
Anywhere in the US is fine but Atlanta would be preferred.
Benefits you'll receive:
In addition to your great compensation package, company subsidized medical/dental/vision coverage plans and matching 401(k), we'll shower you with perks including:
Break room with ping pong, endless snacks and in-office lunch once a week
Unlimited PTO to encourage a healthy work/life balance (2 week min required!)
Modern work schedule focused on getting the job done, not hours clocked
Workplace flexibility
Company and team outings, we encourage a tight-knit workplace
Generous Maternity AND Paternity leave (16 weeks!)
Annual bonus & stock options
Wellness program
Company equipment provided (Windows & Mac options)
Annual performance reviews with opportunity for growth and career development

You must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.

OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY
FOX Entertainment
FOX Entertainment has the power to break through. We seek to pierce pop culture with content that takes big swings, delivers mass appeal and elicits visceral reactions form our audiences. FOX has been the #1 A18-49 rated network for 2 years in a row and we got there through innovation and perseverance, as well as excellent content including shows such as THE MASKED SINGER, 9-1-1, CALL ME KAT and THE GREAT NORTH. FOX Entertainment programming includes a mix of Drama, Comedy, Alternative, Animation and Specials. Also within the Fox family are brands such as TUBI, FOX Alternative Entertainment, FOX SPORTS, FOX NEWS, FOX BET, Bento Box, Blockchain Creative Labs, and Credible.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Duties:
Fox Technology Center, LLC seeks a Computer Systems Engineer (Senior Systems Engineer), responsible for implementing, maintaining, troubleshooting, and supporting virtualization platforms including VMware and AWS, etc. in a multi-site environment. Work with VMWare virtualization products in an enterprise environment. Implement, maintain, troubleshoot, and support enterprise blade technologies, composable infrastructure, and server hardware including HPE OneView/Synergy, Dell VxRail, and Cisco UCS technologies in a multi-site environment. Add structure to IT operations including implementing change management, documentation, best practices, etc. Participate in the support and ongoing maintenance of standards and policies. Identify, resolve and escalate business issues as appropriate. Duties also involve project ownership responsibilities including gathering requirements from diverse business units, documenting the proper design, and following through to project completion. Develop scripts to be used for automation of systems deployments and Cloud management and control.
Job Requirements:
Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, and five (5) years of systems engineering or related experience in designing, building and maintaining IT environment.
In lieu of Bachelor’s degree and five (5) years of systems engineering or related experience in designing, building and maintaining IT environment, will accept seven (7) years of systems engineering or related experience in designing, building and maintaining IT environment.
Experience must include three (3) years of IT experience in infrastructure architecture and design of distributed systems environments, including failover techniques, recovery/rollback and application partitioning; managing private/public/Hybrid Cloud environments such as AWS, Azure or GCP; and working with diagnostic tools, automation, and recovery systems using standard or proprietary scripting and programming utilities.
Specific skills: Also requires experience or knowledge in the following: 1) Cloud orchestration software such as VMWare vRealize Suite; 2) VMWare products including Vsphere 6.X/7.X, HA, DRS, VSAN, Distributed switches and VROPS for monitoring and capacity management; 3) Server technology including blade technology on HPE Synergy or Cisco UCS; 4) Hyperconverged infrastructure including Dell VXRAIL; 5) Powershell, Powercli or other scripting languages; and 6) Network and storage monitoring and troubleshooting
Any level of experience or knowledge in the specific skills is acceptable.

Creighton University is looking for an Enterprise-wide Data Analytics individual. This person will be working closely with a multi-disciplinary team who helps support the Enterprise-wide Data Analytics, Data Security, Data Modeling, and Data Warehousing of the University. Data Analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle data analysis to include requirements, activities, and design. The Data Analyst will work collaboratively with key stakeholders across various departments working on data management and activities to understand requirements, research and analyze data, developing coding logic, creating visualizations, and delivering analytics solutions to drive change and university decision making.
At all times employees are expected to uphold Creighton’s core values and demonstrate commitment to valuing diversity and contributing to an inclusive working and learning environment, while adhering to all University Ethical Standards of Conduct, rules, regulations, and job requirements, including required educational trainings.
Collects complex data from campus partners, including but not limited to finance, facilities, human resources, AIR, process improvement leaders. Maintains data for accuracy, consistency, and completeness of information.
Complete data profiling and define data transformations for use by the University. Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Design and maintain data related Information Systems in support of the university’s data management and reporting needs
Develop and manage new processes which requires coordination of multiple departments (Finance Team, Associate Deans, IT, AIR, Financial Aid Office, Business Office, Registrar and HR) and data sources across the university
Ensures accuracy and integrity of organizational data within the Information Systems
Provides data summaries or statistical analysis for use in strategic planning or decision-making
Manage creation of new data sets and coordinate across departments
Creates standard and ad hoc queries and reports
Design and manage data sets in Tableau (calculated fields, hierarchies, groupings)
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports
The Data Analyst is responsible for helping maintain data integrity, executing data strategy, and performing advanced analysis and updates of constituent data. (S)he performs database cleanup, data formatting and accurate data entry, as well as monitoring the integrity of the information contained in various systems.

Overview:
Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center is an independent, nonprofit organization providing adult cancer treatment and groundbreaking research focused on cancer and infectious diseases. Based in Seattle, Fred Hutch is the only National Cancer Institute-designated cancer center in Washington.

With a track record of global leadership in bone marrow transplantation, HIV/AIDS prevention, immunotherapy and COVID-19 vaccines, Fred Hutch has earned a reputation as one of the world’s leading cancer, infectious disease and biomedical research centers. Fred Hutch operates eight clinical care sites that provide medical oncology, infusion, radiation, proton therapy and related services, and network affiliations with hospitals in five states. Together, our fully integrated research and clinical care teams seek to discover new cures to the world’s deadliest diseases and make life beyond cancer a reality.

At Fred Hutch we value collaboration, compassion, determination, excellence, innovation, integrity and respect. These values are grounded in and expressed through the principles of diversity, equity and inclusion. Our mission is directly tied to the humanity, dignity and inherent value of each employee, patient, community member and supporter. Our commitment to learning across our differences and similarities make us stronger. We seek employees who bring different and innovative ways of seeing the world and solving problems. Fred Hutch is in pursuit of becoming an anti-racist organization. We are committed to ensuring that all candidates hired share our commitment to diversity, anti-racism and inclusion.

The Data Platform Team within Fred Hutch's Information Technology Department is responsible for designing, developing, and supporting FHCC data systems and integration for both operational and analytical purposes.

Under the guidance of the Data Engineer Manager, the Data Engineer (Data Engineer III) is responsible for the development and implementation of scalable, stable, and secure solutions for data acquisition, data distribution, and workflow orchestration in FHCC's data warehouse. The role will also be responsible for leading the Data Engineering function in the maintenance and optimization of existing data pipelines from a wide variety of internal and external data sources, including partner data warehouses and repositories. They will work closely with team members, end users, and other stakeholders to provide solutions that support and empower internal business partners and drive enterprise analytics and data science objectives.

Successful candidates will have strong engineering, communication, and expert level knowledge in on-prem SQL Server data systems. Familiarity with common cloud data tools, best practices and migration strategies is a plus as well as agile development methodologies.

This is a remote position.
Responsibilities:
Design, implement and support ETL/ELT processes sourcing data from various internal applications and external data repositories including our partner EPIC EMR implementations
Monitor and maintain build and release pipelines in Azure Devops using continuous development best practices
Develop and support data infrastructure primarily built with Microsoft technologies
Partner with Test Engineer to target areas of the warehouse and associated processes where testing infrastructure improvements are needed
Foster a collaborative environment with those on the Data Platform team and larger IT department and Business partners
Work with Data Engineers, and systems and business analysts to support and empower technical and non-technical internal stakeholders in their analytics and reporting requirements
Communicate and resolve issues and questions during development, testing, and release of new code
Foster a collaborative environment
Qualifications:
Required:
High school diploma or equivalent
Excellent knowledge and experience developing, performance tuning, and supporting on-prem data engineering systems using Microsoft SQL Server
Excellent knowledge of ETL tools and various data processing techniques and best practices
Expert in database architecture and design, performance tuning, coding, and administration
Experience with complex relational data models and very large data sets
Excellent knowledge of data warehousing design and concepts
Experience in dealing with large and complex data sets and performance tuning
Strong verbal/written communication skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with the business: technical and non-technical teams.
Ability to work independently, manage competing priorities and to adapt to new and changing technologies
Ability to manage business expectations and deliver customer-focused solutions
Strong analytical and organizational skills and an ability to multi-task
Ability to work independently and to adapt to new and changing technologies
Ability to communicate in English, both verbally and in writing
Preferred:
B.Sc or M.Sc degree in quantitative field (Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, etc.), or equivalent training or professional experience
Prior experience in scripting languages (Powershell, Python, or similar)
Prior experience in AWS or Azure cloud data tools/technologies
Experience leading Data Engineering teams
Experience with Cerner and/or Epic healthcare systems
Familiarity with healthcare financial and/or clinical data
Familiarity with HIPAA regulations and data warehousing security best practices

A statement describing your commitment and contributions toward greater diversity, equity, inclusion, and antiracism in your career or that will be made through your work at Fred Hutch is requested of all finalists.
The annual base salary range for this position is from $120,869 to $191,027 and pay offered will be based on experience and qualifications.

Benefits include medical/vision, dental, flexible spending accounts, life, disability, retirement, family life support, employee assistance program, onsite health clinic, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation (12-22 days per year), paid sick leave (12-25 days per year), paid holidays (13 days per year), paid parental leave (up to 4 weeks), and partially paid sabbatical leave (up to 6 months).

DESCRIPTION:
Duties: Contribute to all phases of the application development lifecycle, including requirements gathering, stakeholder engagement, development, testing, and deployment. Assist with Agile software development process. Enact Scrum values and practices. Identify opportunities for process and tool improvements and drive those from concept to implementation. Gather, analyze, access, and adjust the requirements as needed. Enhance the existing features by completing the Software development life cycle without disrupting the existing flow of the application. Ensure quality and completeness of the product through unit, component testing, integration testing, and End to End Testing capabilities. Maintain detailed records of experiments including POC (Proof of Concepts) and outcomes. Conduct analyses and literature reviews, and participate in peer work reviews. Contribute to technical and functional demonstrations and access code changes and new functionalities added to the system. Identify and resolve any technical issues that occur. Implement continuous monitoring to support the application and handle any production issues raised by End users. Perform Release Master duties. Distribute releases on an ad-hoc or monthly basis. Create release branches, deploy the release branches to UAT and gather the testing signoff from the End users. Implement a variety of proofs and merge the code with the master branch after PROD deployment. Create detailed design documentation of all the work being done. Assist with Tech Stack upgrades and adapt new technology with business policies. Perform resiliency activities to make sure the application is functional in times of disasters.

Minimum education and experience required: Master’s degree in Computer Information Systems, Computer Science or related field of study plus 3 years of experience in the job offered or as Software Engineer, Application Developer, Java Developer, or related occupation.
Skills Required: Requires experience in the following: Core and Enterprise Java; Spring framework including Spring Boot, Spring Core, Spring Cloud, and Spring Test; Micro-services, Monolithic architecture and SOLID principles; Data structures; Automated testing using Cucumber, Mockito Framework and Junit; Front end technologies including Javascript, Typescript, and AngularJS ; Databases including MongoDB, DB2, Oracle and SQL; Application design using distributed caching; Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment tools such as Jenkins; Build tools such as Maven and Gradle; Version control tools such as Git or Bit-Bucket; Public Cloud development such as AWS; and supporting applications during production and UAT.
Job Location: 880 Powder Mill Road, Wilmington, DE 19803. Telecommuting permitted up to 40% of the week.

At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.
A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.
Rockstar San Diego is on the lookout for a talented Associate Engine Programmer, who possesses a strong interest in all the low-level technology that makes a modern video game tick. If you like to understand how things really work "under the hood" of your favorite games, we'd love to hear from you.
This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar's studio in Carlsbad. Whether it's the beach or mountains, San Diego is considered one of the best places to live year-round.
WHAT WE DO
The Engine team is a global group of generalist programmers with a keen focus on lower level systems and squeezing the most out of the underlying hardware.
We are responsible for many of the core pieces of technology that underpin Rockstar games – such as memory management, streaming game data efficiently, population systems, LOD, scene management, rendering pipeline, scripting engine, and more.
We collaborate closely with the Graphics team on many systems including vegetation, lighting, occlusion, etc.
We collaborate closely with various Art teams to create believable worlds that feel immersive, solid and hold together under difficult conditions such as rapid player movement, limited system memory and so on.
We coordinate and support the wider efforts across the development team to get our games running smoothly and making best use of system resources.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Implement new core technologies necessary to realize the vision of our games.
Maintain existing codebase and support the wider development team in diagnosing problems and coming up with good solutions.
QUALIFICATIONS
A degree in Computer Science/related discipline, or equivalent experience.
SKILLS
An understanding of computing fundamentals and related terminology.
Demonstrable experience with C/C++ programming.
Excellent problem-solving skills with an emphasis on debugging C++ code.
Ability to collaborate positively with other departments across Rockstar studios.
Strong multi-threaded programming skills.
Analytical skills geared towards the measurement of system performance, memory use etc, plus the communication skills needed to generate solutions.
PLUSES
Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
Self-motivated, enthusiastic/passionate about games and curious about how things work.
Experience with SIMD code.
Understanding of memory layout considerations as related to padding and cache efficiency.
Experience with crash dumps and x86 disassembly.
Strong 3D math skills.
Understanding of code performance considerations, including "big O" notation as related to algorithmic complexity.
HOW TO APPLY
Please apply with a resume and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.
Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.
If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race.
